body:
Tink is a multi-language, cross-platform library that provides simple and misuse-proof APIs for common cryptographic tasks.

This is Tink C++ 2.1.3

To get started using Tink, see [the setup guide](https://developers.google.com/tink/tink-setup#c++).

# What's new?

This is a patch release.

The complete list of changes since 2.1.2 can be found [here](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/compare/v2.1.2...v2.1.3).

*   Bug-fixes:
    *   Use `rapidjson::kParseIterativeFlag` when parsing JSON keysets to make sure the stack size remains constant
    *	Use the correct version in `MODULE.bazel`

# Future work

To see what we're working towards, check our [project roadmap](https://developers.google.com/tink/roadmap).

# Getting started

### CMake

You can import Tink C++ as an in-tree dependency.

```
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.13)

project(Example CXX)

set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD 14)
set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED ON)

set(CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE Release)

# Assumes tink-cc is in third_party.
add_subdirectory(third_party/tink-cc tink)

add_executable(example_app example_app.cc)
target_link_libraries(example_app tink::static)
```

### Bazel

```
workspace(name = "example")

load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "com_github_tink_crypto_tink_cc",
    urls = ["https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/archive/refs/tags/v2.1.3.zip"],
    strip_prefix = "tink-cc-2.1.3",
    sha256 = "14a3f64a56d7e9296889d7eba7a3b8787c3281e5bc5791033c54baf810a0b6ef",
)

# Load Tink dependencies.

load("@com_github_tink_crypto_tink_cc//:tink_cc_deps.bzl", "tink_cc_deps")

tink_cc_deps()

load("@com_github_tink_crypto_tink_cc//:tink_cc_deps_init.bzl", "tink_cc_deps_init")

tink_cc_deps_init()

# ... Your dependencies here ...
```

name: Tink C++ 2.1.2
body:
Tink is a multi-language, cross-platform library that provides simple and misuse-proof APIs for common cryptographic tasks.

This is Tink C++ v2.1.2

To get started using Tink, see [the setup guide](https://developers.google.com/tink/tink-setup#c++).

# What's new?

This is a patch release.

The complete list of changes since 2.1.1 can be found [here](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/compare/v2.1.1...v2.1.2).

* Bug-fixes:
  * Fixed `JsonKeysetReader::Read()` making the process crash if the input JSON is valid but not an object.

# Future work

To see what we're working towards, check our [project roadmap](https://developers.google.com/tink/roadmap).

# Getting started

### CMake

You can import Tink C++ as an in-tree dependency.

```
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.13)

project(Example CXX)

set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD 14)
set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED ON)

set(CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE Release)

# Assumes tink-cc is in third_party.
add_subdirectory(third_party/tink-cc tink)

# Alternatively using FetchContent:
# include(FetchContent)
# FetchContent_Declare(
#   tink
#   URL       https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/archive/refs/tags/v2.1.2.zip
#   URL_HASH  SHA256=d0fefc61e3bde758c8773f1348e6a64fc4fd6ecafe62c4adc0df8957ce800757
# )
# FetchContent_GetProperties(tink)
# if(NOT googletest_POPULATED)
#   FetchContent_Populate(tink)
#     add_subdirectory(${tink_SOURCE_DIR} ${tink_BINARY_DIR} EXCLUDE_FROM_ALL)
# endif()

add_executable(example_app example_app.cc)
target_link_libraries(example_app tink::static)
```

### Bazel

```
workspace(name = "example")

load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "com_github_tink_crypto_tink_cc",
    strip_prefix = "tink-cc-2.1.2",
    urls = ["https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/releases/download/v2.1.2/tink-cc-2.1.2.zip"],
    sha256 = "d0fefc61e3bde758c8773f1348e6a64fc4fd6ecafe62c4adc0df8957ce800757",
)

# Load Tink dependencies.

load("@com_github_tink_crypto_tink_cc//:tink_cc_deps.bzl", "tink_cc_deps")

tink_cc_deps()

load("@com_github_tink_crypto_tink_cc//:tink_cc_deps_init.bzl", "tink_cc_deps_init")

tink_cc_deps_init()

# ... Your dependencies here ...
```

name: Tink C++ 2.1.1
body:
Tink is a multi-language, cross-platform library that provides simple and misuse-proof APIs for common cryptographic tasks.

This is Tink C++ 2.1.1

To get started using Tink, see [the setup guide](https://developers.google.com/tink/tink-setup#c++).

### CMake

You can import Tink C++ as an in-tree dependency.

```
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.13)

project(Example CXX)

set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD 14)
set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED ON)

set(CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE Release)

# Assumes tink-cc is in third_party.
add_subdirectory(third_party/tink-cc tink)

add_executable(example_app example_app.cc)
target_link_libraries(example_app tink::static)
```

### Bazel

```
workspace(name = "example")

load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "com_github_tink_crypto_tink_cc",
    urls = ["https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/archive/refs/tags/v2.1.1.zip"],
    strip_prefix = "tink-cc-2.1.1",
    sha256 = "3080600b6c38421ebaca5bfc460aa965afc88c877695c080019a8905f0f1c1b8",
)

# Load Tink dependencies.

load("@com_github_tink_crypto_tink_cc//:tink_cc_deps.bzl", "tink_cc_deps")

tink_cc_deps()

load("@com_github_tink_crypto_tink_cc//:tink_cc_deps_init.bzl", "tink_cc_deps_init")

tink_cc_deps_init()

# ... Your dependencies here ...
```

## What's new

This is a patch release.

The complete list of changes since 2.1.0 can be found [here](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/compare/v2.1.0...v2.1.1).

*   Bug-fixing:
    *   Parsing a keyset with an invalid HMAC key (which has an invalid hash
        type) can cause a binary compiled without "NDEBUG" to crash. This is now
        fixed.
*  `ConfigGlobalRegistry` is now publicly visible.

## Future work

To see what we're working towards, check our [project roadmap](https://developers.google.com/tink/roadmap).

name: Tink C++ 2.1.0
body:
Tink is a multi-language, cross-platform library that provides simple and misuse-proof APIs for common cryptographic tasks.

This is Tink C++ 2.1.0

To get started using Tink, see [the setup guide](https://developers.google.com/tink/tink-setup#c++).

### CMake

You can import Tink C++ as an in-tree dependency.

```
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.13)

project(Example CXX)

set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD 14)
set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED ON)

set(CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE Release)

# Assumes tink-cc is in third_party.
add_subdirectory(third_party/tink-cc tink)

add_executable(example_app example_app.cc)
target_link_libraries(example_app tink::static)
```

### Bazel

```
workspace(name = "example")

load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "com_github_tink_crypto_tink_cc",
    urls = ["https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/archive/refs/tags/v2.1.0.zip"],
    strip_prefix = "tink-cc-2.1.0",
    sha256 = "3804afecbe7096d3786b660e9cd5f365f064743eec52d76984abb9da38dd0fb3",
)

# Load Tink dependencies.

load("@com_github_tink_crypto_tink_cc//:tink_cc_deps.bzl", "tink_cc_deps")

tink_cc_deps()

load("@com_github_tink_crypto_tink_cc//:tink_cc_deps_init.bzl", "tink_cc_deps_init")

tink_cc_deps_init()

# ... Your dependencies here ...
```

## What's new

The complete list of changes since 2.0.0 can be found [here](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/compare/2.0...2.1).

* Tink now supports building with OpenSSL 3.0 ([commit](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/commit/4b09176a3d6eb92e05decffa60dbd94d605a4671))
* Tink now supports key derivation ([commit](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/commit/83e5cad621714edee8ef32124fd4b53a3aa224a6))
* For the following key types, an API to import and export keys has been added:
  * HMAC ([commit](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/commit/c47925bb09b4a267954155133e159edab598661f)
  * AES GCM ([commit](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/commit/0954266ba493846c5128444fa43b121bcd996ce2))
  * AES SIV ([commit](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/commit/071566f184b2a04e7ca31075950a9912a4a988ad))
  * HPKE ([commit](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/commit/35f1b6bbb8a68d23ca0785dc76da7d244623ab64))
  * RSASSA-PKCS1 ([commit](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/commit/8ecf6c347aba69f677397ff966013da812a5ab52))
  * RSASSA-PSS ([commit](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/commit/20d975d63f18001249b4054ac8c618614e204b32))

(When exporting, this can be used with `KeysetHandle::operator[]` and a dynamic cast. When importing keys, this can be used with the `KeysetHandleBuilder`)

* Methods `KeysetHandle::GetPrimitive`, `KeysetHandle::GenerateNew`, and `KeysetHandle::GetPublicKeysetHandle` now take a configuration argument
* Tink defines `crypto::tink::ConfigV0()` and `crypto::tink::ConfigFips140_2()`
* Upgraded dependencies:
  * The abseil dependency has been upgraded to LTS 20230802.0
* Bug-fixing
  * Calling `RandomAccessStream::size()` for `RandomAccessStream` objects obtained from `StreamingAead::NewDecryptingRandomAccessStream` now attempts to find the correct key in the keyset. Previously, users had to  first call `PRead` to make sure calling `size` works. ([commit](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/commit/de6dcf96bd0cc882d55f44589e4a31a49dbcfc4b))

## Future work

To see what we're working towards, check our [project roadmap](https://developers.google.com/tink/roadmap).

name: Tink C++ 2.0.0
body:
Tink is a multi-language, cross-platform library that provides simple and misuse-proof APIs for common cryptographic tasks.

This is Tink C++ 2.0.0

To get started using Tink, see [the setup guide](https://developers.google.com/tink/tink-setup#c++).

### CMake

You can import Tink C++ as an in-tree dependency.

```
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.13)

project(Example CXX)

set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD 14)
set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED ON)

set(CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE Release)

# Assumes tink-cc is in third_party.
add_subdirectory(third_party/tink-cc tink)

add_executable(example_app example_app.cc)
target_link_libraries(example_app tink::static)
```

### Bazel

```
workspace(name = "example")

load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "com_github_tink_crypto_tink_cc",
    urls = ["https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/archive/refs/tags/v2.0.0.zip"],
    strip_prefix = "tink-cc-2.0.0",
    sha256 = "103ddfce800e77f3b3b6b2c808a8611bc734b31ddb12fbcfd8bebc1b96a7e963",
)

# Load Tink dependencies.

load("@com_github_tink_crypto_tink_cc//:tink_cc_deps.bzl", "tink_cc_deps")

tink_cc_deps()

load("@com_github_tink_crypto_tink_cc//:tink_cc_deps_init.bzl", "tink_cc_deps_init")

tink_cc_deps_init()

# ... Your dependencies here ...
```

> WARNING: Different from 1.7.0, labels are now prefixed by `tink`: for example `@tink_cc`
> becomes `@tink_cc//tink:tink_cc`, or `@tink_cc//aead/...` becomes
> `@tink_cc//tink/aead/...`.
>
>
> Bazel users of Tink can use the script `tools/update_build_files_for_tink_2_0_bazel.sh` to apply the necessary Bazel changes to their > BUILD files:
>
> ```shell
> cd <path/to/tink_cc>
> bazel run //tools:update_build_files_for_tink_2_0_bazel -- <path/to/you/project/root> \
>   <tink-cc repository name>
> ```

> WARNING: KMS extensions are now published in separate repositories:
>  - https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc-awskms
>  - https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc-gcpkms

## What's new

This is the first release from https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc.

The complete list of changes since 1.7.0 can be found [here](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/compare/fe002699c8c55af2e69c7bc88b0646b3ee796f21...2.0).

-   Upgraded to use Bazel 6.0.0
-   Changed minimum C++ version to C++14
-   Changed minimum version of CMake to 3.13
-   Changed the structure of the  repository adding sources to `tink`. As a consequence, target labels are now prefixed with `tink`, for example `@tink_cc` becomes `@tink_cc//tink:tink_cc`, or `@tink_cc//aead/...` becomes `@tink_cc//tink/aead/...`.
-   KMS extensions are now published to separate repositories:
    -   https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc-awskms
    -   https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc-gcpkms
-   Upgraded dependencies:
    -   Abseil LTS 20230125
    -   BoringSSL (Commit from 2023-02-15)
    -   Protobuf X.21.9
-   Added support for building on Windows with Microsoft Visual Studio 2019 version 16.10.4.0 or later with CMake and Bazel
-   Added walkthrough examples and ability to build examples with CMake
-   Added new keyset handle APIs (experimental)
-   Added/upgraded CI test scripts
-   Removed deprecated APIs:
    -   Removed Catalogue APIs (commits: [#1](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/commit/418e6b89f8492a62a23b445bc65007b17836f5af), [#2](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/commit/b3adfcfc9b853189c804e0444af2eb5576bf5533), [#3](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/commit/74a1ab60781e039a9e9fcf3a52fee24cac508779)).
    -   Removed `RegisterKeyManager` from `Registry` (commits: [#1](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/commit/95edae552bdf077942ca445bc5d01c64e73dba3d))
    -   Removed `Latest` from Tink's `*_config.h` (commits: [#1](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/commit/8c98e5586a4ca411b8bbbaf0a67ac43962d9a99b))
    -   Removed `config.h` (commits: [#1](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/commit/753c5c03b900abd6577405b85e8bd4d2cee5ed8b))
-   Make `util::Status` an alias of `absl::Status` (commits: [#1](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/commit/66e9b1617ead7f68129d9a67770f42794a76c008), [#2](https://github.com/tink-crypto/tink-cc/commit/6809f68729dacfbc10714f6086ae144617395676))
